message.content:
Search GitHub for MCP servers or tools that allow using Gemini CLI as sub-agents or that support Gemini OAuth/login authentication instead of API keys. Look for:
1. "gemini cli mcp server"
2. "gemini mcp oauth"
3. "google gemini cli agent"
4. Any tools that let you use Gemini with your Google account login rather than API keys

Return the most relevant repositories with their URLs and descriptions.

# run-gemini-cli

## Overview

`run-gemini-cli` is a GitHub Action that integrates [Gemini] into your development workflow via the [Gemini CLI]. It acts both as an autonomous agent for critical routine coding tasks, and an on-demand collaborator you can quickly delegate work to.

Use it to perform GitHub pull request reviews, triage issues, perform code analysis and modification, and more using [Gemini] conversationally (e.g., `@gemini-cli fix this issue`) directly inside your GitHub repositories.

# Gemini CLI Assistant

In this guide you will learn how to use the Gemini CLI Assistant via GitHub Actions. It serves as an on-demand collaborator you can quickly delegate work to, invoked directly in GitHub Pull Request and Issue comments to perform a wide range of tasks‚Äîfrom code analysis and modifications to project management. When you invoke the workflow via `@gemini-cli`, it uses a customizable set of tools to understand the context, execute your request, and respond within the same thread.

```bash
mkdir -p .github/workflows
curl -o .github/workflows/gemini-dispatch.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/google-github-actions/run-gemini-cli/main/examples/workflows/gemini-dispatch/gemini-dispatch.yml

curl -o .github/workflows/gemini-scheduled-triage.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/google-github-actions/run-gemini-cli/main/examples/workflows/issue-triage/gemini-scheduled-triage.yml
```

1. Download the [gemini-cli-dashboard.json](/dashboard/gemini-cli-health-dashboard.json) file from this repository.
2. Go to the Google Cloud Console > Monitoring > Dashboards.
3. Click Create Dashboard.
4. Switch to the JSON Editor tab.
5. Copy and paste the contents of gemini-cli-dashboard.json.
6. Click Apply.

# gemini-cli

`gemini-cli` is a simple yet versatile command-line interface for Google's
Gemini LLMs, written in Go. It includes tools for chatting with these models and
generating / comparing embeddings, with powerful SQLite storage and analysis
capabilities.

## Installing

Install `gemini-cli` on your machine with:

```
$ go install github.com/eliben/gemini-cli@latest
```

You can then invoke `gemini-cli help` to verify it's properly installed and

# run-gemini-cli

## Overview

`run-gemini-cli` is a GitHub Action that integrates [Gemini] into your development workflow via the [Gemini CLI]. It acts both as an autonomous agent for critical routine coding tasks, and an on-demand collaborator you can quickly delegate work to.

Use it to perform GitHub pull request reviews, triage issues, perform code analysis and modification, and more using [Gemini] conversationally (e.g., `@gemini-cli fix this issue`) directly inside your GitHub repositories.

```gitignore
# gemini-cli settings

--- Snippet 2 (Line 56) ---
1. Run the `/setup-github` command in Gemini CLI on your terminal to set up workflows for your repository.
2. Copy the workflow files into your repository's `.github/workflows` directory:

```bash
mkdir -p .github/workflows
curl -o .github/workflows/gemini-dispatch.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/google-github-actions/run-gemini-cli/main/examples/workflows/gemini-dispatch/gemini-dispatch.yml
curl -o .github/workflows/gemini-triage.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/google-github-actions/run-gemini-cli/main/examples/workflows/issue-triage/gemini-triage.yml
curl -o .github/workflows/gemini-scheduled-triage.yml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/google-github-actions/run-gemini-cli/main/examples/workflows/issue-triage/gemini-scheduled-triage.yml
```

    # Ideal method to disable auto-update

Repository: icopy-site/awesome-cn
Path: docs/awesome/awesome-gemini-cli.md
URL: https://github.com/icopy-site/awesome-cn/blob/master/docs/awesome/awesome-gemini-cli.md
License: Apache-2.0

Snippets:
--- Snippet 1 (Line 111) ---
- [gemini-cli-proxy](https://github.com/nettee/gemini-cli-proxy) - OpenAI-compatible API wrapper for Gemini CLI as an OpenAI-compatible API service, allowing you to enjoy the free Gemini 2.5 Pro model through API!
- [CLIProxyAPI](https://github.com/router-form-me/CLIProxyAPI) - Wrap Gemini CLI as an OpenAI/Gemini/Claude compatible API service, allowing you to enjoy the free Gemini 2.5 Pro model through API.
- [gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge](https://github.com/Intelligent-Internet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge) - Server application that extends the Google Gemini CLI with MCP toolkit and OpenAI-compatible API bridge.

## Commands & Extensions

**üëâ See also: [Awesome Gemini CLI Extensions](https://github.com/Piebald-AI/awesome-gemini-cli-extensions)** \
Custom commands and extensions that add new capabilities to Gemini CLI.


--- Snippet 2 (Line 141) ---
- [mcp-gemini-cli](https://github.com/choplin/mcp-gemini-cli) - A simple MCP (Model Context Protocol) server wrapper for Google's Gemini CLI.
- [gemini-cli-mcp](https://github.com/InfolabAI/gemini-cli-mcp) - Tool that enables using Gemini AI as an MCP server within Claude Code with large file analysis and token savings.
- [gemini-mcp](https://github.com/neriousy/gemini-mcp) - A simple MCP server for using the Gemini CLI.
- [gemini-cli-mcp](https://github.com/0xmountaintop/gemini-cli-mcp) - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) wrapper for Google Gemini CLI that enables AI development tools to interact with Gemini.

## Neovim Plugins

Plugins that bring Gemini CLI's AI capabilities directly into the Neovim editor.

Snippets:
--- Snippet 1 (Line 1) ---
# Gemini CLI - MCP/OpenAI Bridge Server

[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-Apache%202.0-blue.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/Apache-2.0)
[![Node.js Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/node-%3E%3D18.0.0-brightgreen)](https://nodejs.org/)
[![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@intelligentinternet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@intelligentinternet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge)

[‰∏≠ÊñáÊñáÊ°£](https://github.com/Intelligent-Internet/gemini-cli-common-bridge/blob/main/README.zh.md)

> **üéâ Built on Open Source Gemini CLI - Thanks to Google!**  
> This project is built upon the open-source [Gemini CLI](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli) by Google. We appreciate Google's commitment to open source and their contribution to the developer community.

`@intelligentinternet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge` (or `gemini-cli-bridge`) is a versatile server application designed as a powerful extension to the `gemini-cli` ecosystem. It serves two primary roles:

1. **MCP Toolkit**: Exposes all built-in tools from `gemini-cli` (such as file system operations, web search powered by Gemini models, and web content understanding) through a unified MCP endpoint.
   - Can also connect to any number of external MCP servers (only allowed in YOLO mode or when specific tools are configured in `configured` mode).

# Gemini CLI - MCP/OpenAI Bridge Server

[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-Apache%202.0-blue.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/Apache-2.0)
[![Node.js Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/node-%3E%3D18.0.0-brightgreen)](https://nodejs.org/)
[![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@intelligentinternet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@intelligentinternet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge)

[‰∏≠ÊñáÊñáÊ°£](https://github.com/Intelligent-Internet/gemini-cli-common-bridge/blob/main/README.zh.md)

> **üéâ Built on Open Source Gemini CLI - Thanks to Google!**  
> This project is built upon the open-source [Gemini CLI](https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli) by Google. We appreciate Google's commitment to open source and their contribution to the developer community.

`@intelligentinternet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge` (or `gemini-cli-bridge`) is a versatile server application designed as a powerful extension to the `gemini-cli` ecosystem. It serves two primary roles:

1. **MCP Toolkit**: Exposes all built-in tools from `gemini-cli` (such as file system operations, web search powered by Gemini models, and web content understanding) through a unified MCP endpoint.
   - Can also connect to any number of external MCP servers (only allowed in YOLO mode or when specific tools are configured in `configured` mode).

4. **Visual Management**: You can upload or delete credentials at any time in the Web UI, or use the **"Quick Associate"** function to bind existing credential files to providers with one click.

#### Gemini CLI OAuth Configuration
1. **Obtain OAuth Credentials**: Visit [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/) to create a project and enable Gemini API
2. **Project Configuration**: You may need to provide a valid Google Cloud project ID, which can be specified via the startup parameter `--project-id`
3. **Ensure Project ID**: When configuring in the Web UI, ensure the project ID entered matches the project ID displayed in the Google Cloud Console and Gemini CLI.

- `[Gemini CLI]` - Access via Gemini CLI OAuth
- `[OpenAI]` - Use official OpenAI API
- `[Qwen CLI]` - Access via Qwen OAuth

Repository: Wei-Shaw/sub2api
Path: deploy/README.md
URL: https://github.com/Wei-Shaw/sub2api/blob/main/deploy/README.md
License: MIT

Snippets:
--- Snippet 1 (Line 108) ---

Sub2API supports three methods to connect to Gemini:

### Method 1: Code Assist OAuth (Recommended for GCP Users)

**No configuration needed** - always uses the built-in Gemini CLI OAuth client (public).

1. Leave `GEMINI_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID` and `GEMINI_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET` empty
2. In the Admin UI, create a Gemini OAuth account and select **"Code Assist"** type
3. Complete the OAuth flow in your browser

4. **Visual Management**: You can upload or delete credentials at any time in the Web UI, or use the **"Quick Associate"** function to bind existing credential files to providers with one click.

#### Gemini CLI OAuth Configuration
1. **Obtain OAuth Credentials**: Visit [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/) to create a project and enable Gemini API
2. **Project Configuration**: You may need to provide a valid Google Cloud project ID, which can be specified via the startup parameter `--project-id`

--- Snippet 1 (Line 108) ---

Sub2API supports three methods to connect to Gemini:

### Method 1: Code Assist OAuth (Recommended for GCP Users)

**No configuration needed** - always uses the built-in Gemini CLI OAuth client (public).

1. Leave `GEMINI_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID` and `GEMINI_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET` empty
2. In the Admin UI, create a Gemini OAuth account and select **"Code Assist"** type
3. Complete the OAuth flow in your browser

content.text:
Based on my comprehensive search, here are the most relevant GitHub repositories for using Gemini CLI as sub-agents or with OAuth/Google account authentication instead of API keys:

---

## MCP Servers for Using Gemini CLI as Sub-Agents

### 1. **mcp-gemini-cli** (choplin)
- **URL**: https://github.com/choplin/mcp-gemini-cli
- **Description**: A simple MCP (Model Context Protocol) server wrapper for Google's Gemini CLI. Allows you to add Gemini CLI as an MCP server that can be used by Claude Code or other MCP clients.
- **Quick Start**: `claude mcp add -s project gemini-cli -- npx mcp-gemini-cli --allow-npx`

### 2. **gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge** (Intelligent-Internet)
- **URL**: https://github.com/Intelligent-Internet/gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge
- **Description**: Server application that extends the Google Gemini CLI with MCP toolkit and OpenAI-compatible API bridge. Exposes all built-in tools from gemini-cli (file system operations, web search, web content understanding) through a unified MCP endpoint.
- **License**: Apache-2.0

### 3. **gemini-cli-mcp** (InfolabAI)
- **URL**: https://github.com/InfolabAI/gemini-cli-mcp
- **Description**: Tool that enables using Gemini AI as an MCP server within Claude Code with large file analysis and token savings.

### 4. **gemini-cli-mcp** (0xmountaintop)
- **URL**: https://github.com/0xmountaintop/gemini-cli-mcp
- **Description**: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) wrapper for Google Gemini CLI that enables AI development tools to interact with Gemini.

### 5. **claude-gemini-mcp-slim** (cmdaltctr)
- **URL**: https://github.com/cmdaltctr/claude-gemini-mcp-slim
- **Description**: Slim Gemini CLI MCP Server with streaming and API integration. Implements comprehensive MCP setup and enhanced configuration.
- **License**: MIT

### 6. **gemini-mcp** (neriousy)
- **URL**: https://github.com/neriousy/gemini-mcp
- **Description**: A simple MCP server for using the Gemini CLI.

---

## OAuth/Google Account Login Tools (No API Key Required)

### 7. **AIClient-2-API** (justlovemaki)
- **URL**: https://github.com/justlovemaki/AIClient-2-API
- **Description**: Provides **Gemini CLI OAuth** support that allows accessing Gemini through Google account login rather than API keys. Supports multiple providers including `gemini-cli-oauth` routes. Features automatic OAuth credential generation through Google Cloud Console integration.
- **License**: GPL-3.0
- **Routes**: `/gemini-cli-oauth/v1/chat/completions` (OpenAI protocol), `/gemini-cli-oauth/v1/messages` (Claude protocol)

### 8. **opencode-antigravity-auth** (NoeFabris)
- **URL**: https://github.com/NoeFabris/opencode-antigravity-auth
- **Description**: Antigravity + Gemini CLI OAuth Plugin for Opencode. Enables OAuth authentication for Gemini CLI.

### 9. **sub2api** (Wei-Shaw)
- **URL**: https://github.com/Wei-Shaw/sub2api
- **Description**: Supports multiple methods to connect to Gemini including **Code Assist OAuth** (recommended for GCP users) - uses built-in Gemini CLI OAuth client without needing to configure API keys.
- **License**: MIT

---

## Official Google Gemini CLI Repository

### 10. **google-gemini/gemini-cli** (Official)
- **URL**: https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli
- **Description**: The official open-source AI agent from Google that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal. Supports MCP server configurations and has built-in OAuth token storage for MCP servers (`gemini-cli-mcp-oauth`).
- **License**: Apache-2.0
- **Install**: `npm install -g @google/gemini-cli`

---

## Multi-Agent Frameworks

### 11. **CommonGround** (Intelligent-Internet)
- **URL**: https://github.com/Intelligent-Internet/CommonGround
- **Description**: Full system deployment including pre-configured `gemini-cli-bridge` for multi-agent mode. Uses the gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge as a submodule with Docker support for OAuth callback handling.

### 12. **aicode-toolkit** (AgiFlow)
- **URL**: https://github.com/AgiFlow/aicode-toolkit
- **Description**: Coding agent bridge that supports Gemini CLI as one of the agent options ("Google Gemini CLI agent"), with MCP server configuration support.
- **License**: AGPL-3.0

---

## Summary

For **using Gemini CLI as a sub-agent** from Claude Code or other tools, the best options are:
- **mcp-gemini-cli** (choplin) - simplest setup
- **gemini-cli-mcp-openai-bridge** - most feature-rich with OpenAI-compatible API

For **OAuth/Google Account login without API keys**:
- **AIClient-2-API** - comprehensive solution with Web UI for OAuth management
- **sub2api** - supports Code Assist OAuth method
- The official **google-gemini/gemini-cli** itself supports OAuth login through your Google account
